result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

charges.descr: Capture an Intimate Representation  (Victim < 18 years old)

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jason M Hutterer

records.addlTxt: Received and Filed

Defendant Jason M Hutterer in court.  Attorney Nicole A. Muller in court for Jason M Hutterer.  Attorney Erin Michelle Karshen in court for State of Wisconsin. 

Court address Defense Motion for Sanctions.  Brief statements made.  Court takes no action.

Court place thoughts on the merits on the record as to Defense Motion to Suppress.  Additional arguments heard.  Defense request additional time to file a reply.  Court grants request.  Defense reply due 10/21.
Motion hearing scheduled for November 10, 2022 at 11:00 am.
DEFENDANT'S REQUEST FOR SANCTIONS ON STATE FOR FAILURE TO ABIDE BY SCHEDULING ORDER, received and filed.
STATE'S RESPONSE TO DEFENSE MOTION TO SUPPRESS, received and filed.
received and filed.
DEFENDANT'S NOTICE OF MOTION AND  MOTION TO SUPPRESS ILLEGALLY OBTAINED EVIDENCE, received and filed.
FELONY PRETRIAL SCHEDULING ORDER, signed and filed.

Defendant Jason M Hutterer in court with attorney Nicole A. Muller.  Erin Michelle Karshen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Defense is requesting modification of the conditions.  Defense request temporary 3rd party contact to coordinate time to enter residence to obtain property.  State request to work the details out to between the parties.

Discovery has been received.  The content of the photos were redacted.  State does not have the unredacted version.  Defense needs to meet to view the unredacted copies.  Defense request a motion hearing date for a Motion to Suppress.  Defense to filed the motion by September 7th, States response by September 16th, and any reply be defense is due by September 23rd.  Motion hearing scheduled for October 7, 2022 at 03:30 pm.

Defendant Jason M Hutterer in court, appear by video with attorney Nicole A. Muller, appear by video.  Gregg Herman appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State: Dectective A. Hulzem.    State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 15.  Bail/bond hearing scheduled for August 17, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Jason M Hutterer in court in person.  John Daniel Flynn appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a preliminary hearing. States witness is present. Defense filed a motion to adjourn. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 13, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Received and Filed.
Received, Filed, and Forwarded to the Judge for review; MOTION TO ADJOURN PRELIMINARY HEARING
Signed and Filed. Order Appointing Attorney at County Expense

Defendant Jason M Hutterer in court.  
Erin Michelle Karshen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Court conducted Indigency Hearing. Court held colloquy with defendant. Court found defendant is eligible for appointment of counsel by court.  Defendant requested court appointed counsel and agreed to reimburse Milwaukee County for the expense. The court appointed Atty. Nicole Muller, whom was notified via email of new date, she will represent defendant in this matter at County expense and at the rate of $100.00 per hour. The court ordered the defendant repay the County at a rate of $50.00 per month beginning on 02/01/2023 and then the 1st of each month there after. Court advised defendant failure to pay will result in a civil judgment. 
Court holds colloquy with defendant regarding time limits for a preliminary hearing. Defendant WAIVES time limits. Case calendared for preliminary hearing before Preliminary Hearing court.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 5, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Jason M Hutterer in court.  Abby Rockendorf appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a preliminary hearing. Defendant appears without counsel.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Watts, Branch 15. Court orders the case adjourned for CAUSE for an Indigency Hearing.  Indigency hearing scheduled for April 21, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

ADDRESS INFO for Jason M Hutterer
Current: 3100 W Layton Ave, Milwaukee, WI 53221   (Effective: 03-21-2022)
Prior: 934 South 36th Street #Upper, Milwaukee, WI 53215
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with A.K. and L.D
Court ordered Justice Point Pretrial Services LEVEL 1 SUPERVISION.  Court reminders.

Defendant Jason M Hutterer in court with attorney Fred Richardson. Defendant Jason M Hutterer in custody. Mallory R Davis appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Jason M Hutterer appeared by video means with Attorney. Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Watts, Branch 15.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.    DEFENDANT DOES NOT QUALIFY FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION IF RELEASED FROM CUSTODY.

This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea
Preliminary Hearing scheduled for March 31, 2022 at 1:30pm
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
